text:
Climate change is one
of the major challenges
of this generation.

And businesses have
played an important role

in creating the forces that
are changing the climate

and developing the
solutions that are hopefully

going to slow climate change and
perhaps even reverse its course.

I'm Mike Toffel, a professor
at Harvard Business School

and the host of the
Climate Rising podcast.

Climate Rising is a podcast
that focuses on the intersection
of business and climate change.

This podcast is meant to expose
listeners to the many ways

that companies are
actually addressing

climate change, whether
through mitigation,

which is reducing their
impact on climate,

or adaptation, dealing with
how companies are responding

to the changes that are actually
happening outside their windows,

in their operations, and
in their supply chains.

In Climate Rising, we tend
to run four to six episodes
in a row on the same topic--
net zero targets, what are they?

Artificial intelligence,
how is that being
used to develop solutions?

Or media and
entertainment, how are they

thinking about climate in
narrative storytelling?

We range from major companies
like Microsoft and Google

to consulting companies,
like Boston Consulting Group,

to startups that are all
tackling these types of issues.

What I hope that
people take away

from listening to the
podcast is that there's

a much wider array
of opportunities

in the business and
climate change space
than they ever imagined.

And that there's a
role, or an industry,

or maybe even a
company that they

hadn't heard of that
they think, that

might be something
I want to pursue.

HBS is a place where we
take business and climate
change seriously.

We get access to a whole
host of business leaders.

We wanted to open
up those doors so

that those who don't
happen to be on our campus

can still benefit from
some of the insights

that we're learning by
speaking to managers every day.
